result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert Thornton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Albert Thornton in court.  Attorney Corey Flynn for Maryann Corea in court for Albert Thornton.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler Rubenzel in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. and requests additional time to review.
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Albert Thornton
Current: 4566 N. 75th St., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 4049 North 71st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LK.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Albert Thornton in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to a Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/3/22 @ 2p
